paper.title: Nonparametric regression via higher degree F-transform for implied volatility surface estimation
paper.abstract: Estimation of the implied volatility surface is a crucial step for pricing of illiquid or non-listed options. For its estimation we use market data of traded liquid options. In order to obtain smooth surface we mostly use some nonparametric regression approach, though some combination of market data can lead to the inconsistency of the estimated values (i.e. leading to arbitrage opportunities). In this contribution we focus on a novel nonparametric regression approach based on fuzzy transform technique. The original definition is extended into multivariate higher degree F-transform so that we are able to smooth (2 + 1) D discrete data. Proposed procedure allows us to calculate also partial derivatives of the estimated function easily. Extending the optimization problem by suitable constraint we can prevent most of the sources of arbitrage related to option valuation with implied volatility smiles.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用非参数回归方法估计隐含波动率曲面，这是衍生品定价中的关键步骤，特别是用于定价非流动性或未上市期权。论文还提到通过约束优化问题来防止与期权估值相关的套利机会，这进一步证实了其在衍生品定价领域的应用。
